result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
***OFF THE RECORD***

HELD OFF THE RECORD, CCAP REMOTE ACCESS DOWN

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman not in court, in custody in Waukesha County.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court in person for Kenneth A Twyman.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Case updates heard by both parties. Both parties agree to setting future court dates. Matter is adjourned.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:59 PM Defendant Kenneth A Twyman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court for Kenneth A Twyman.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Lindert. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 06.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman not in court, in custody in Waukesha County.  Attorney Mark D. Richards in court in person for Kenneth A Twyman.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set to continue a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is not produced. Court is informed that the defendant refused to be transported. Defense Counsel motions to dismiss. Motion is denied. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark D. Richards in court by video, defendant Kenneth A Twyman not in court, in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Twyman is not produced from Waukesha. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a continued Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court by video with Attorney Mark D. Richards who appears in person.  Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in custody.  Paul Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Fedel. State requests an adjournment for additional testimony from another detective.   Court ordered case adjourned for a continued Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with T.J
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in court with attorney Mark D. Richards.  Defendant Kenneth A Twyman in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT RETAIN PRIVATE COUNSEL. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Attorney Mark Richards received and filed.
